The Bill, therefore, proposes to prolong the insurance of persons who are able to show that their absence from work has been due not to any change in their normal occupation, but to inability to obtain employment.The cost of providing benefits in these cases will fall on the funds of Approved Societies, and no additional cost to the Exchequer beyond the normal statutory contribution is involved. .178-2.a [11 & 12 Geo. 5.] National Health Insurance (Prolongation of Insurance).DRAFTOP AB I L LTOExtend temporarily the period during which a.d. 1921. persons who are unemployed may remain insured under the general provisions of the National Health Insurance Acts, 1911 to 1921.BE it enacted hy the King's most Excellent Majesty, hy and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, 5 as follows : 1.
